blog.title: Lady Questfire
blog.description: Pisces girl doing fishy things, Jonsa Lover, Jon Snow's 2nd wife

body:
(Northern) Independence Matters

I’ve heard it all this week. The North “kneeling” to Danerys makes sense - she’s come to save the North from total destruction from the White Walkers so its the least the North can do but kneel.

1. Why is subservience and totally allegiance to a foreign queen who knows nothing about Westeros needed? If Danerys truly wanted to help prevent an apocalypse why not just say you’ve come to fight side by side for the benefit of all the kingdoms? Why the quid pro quo? I thought she was Mhyssa, protector of the realms, a savior? Imagine the Avengers saying sorry Earthlings we can’t help you unless we are guaranteed payment for our work. #sharwma every night y’all.

2. I can’t imagine swearing allegiance won’t come with heavy cost. Heavy taxation to pay for say the rebuilding of KL or to redistribute wealth. The Greyjoy’s had to swear the Ironborn would change their ways for their allegiance. I can’t imagine a world where the North has to agree to rules and customs from a woman uneducated on even basic Westeros or Northern history and culture (I mean, does she understand why kneeling is generally done in public and physically on ones knees?)

Am I missing something here? Why give up your home, your lands, your customs and freedoms to a remade dynasty responsible for the deaths of your former Lords, that hasn’t proven itself established to rule again, for the sake of saving yourself from destruction? I ask again: shouldn’t there be other options between bend the knee submission and death? 🧐

summary: I honestly forgot about this blog, which makes me sad, especially as the url is so good! haha  But with Season 8 of Game of...
body:
I honestly forgot about this blog, which makes me sad, especially as the url is so good! haha 

But with Season 8 of Game of Thrones on it’s way, I figured I try to start using it again. I’ll post some of my fanfiction here soon as well as some other bits and set up a queue.

places like the citadel and braavos are brimming with creativity
you have characters such as sansa and sam who contribute so much intellectually
plus arya asha bran who constantly learn
but you have a beautiful renaissance of characters
idk i think we focus on the brutal side of asoiaf
summary: Don't be so gloomy. After all it's not that awful. You know what the fellow said – in Italy, for thirty years under the Borgias,...
caption:
Don’t be so gloomy. After all it’s not that awful. You know what the fellow said – in Italy, for thirty years under the Borgias, they had warfare, terror, murder and bloodshed, but they produced Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci and the Renaissance. In Switzerland, they had brotherly love, they had five hundred years of democracy and peace – and what did that produce? The cuckoo clock.

The Third Man ~ Orson Welles

summary: while the idea of sansa being queen in the north/lady of winterfell at the end of the series with no husband has a certain...
body: while the idea of sansa being queen in the north/lady of winterfell at the end of the series with no husband has a certain aesthetic appeal for me, i can’t help but think i’ll stress if i don’t know she marries a good guy. if the ending is open-ended, with sansa on her own, i’ll just be thinking that she got stuck with someone terrible. maybe that’s misogynistic of me, i just don’t want to imagine her character going through any more pain after the series ends.

tags: my idea of a happy person
caption: Me.

title: Story Time:
body:
I’m just gonna be real honest here: it’s hard to share sometimes on this hellsite, but I wanna anyway.

I should preface this by saying that I was an avid j*nerys shipper before when watching season 7. Like many, I was all consumed by the hype the showrunners were building–too consumed to look past surface level. I couldn’t understand Jonsa or why people shipped it. And I don’t like ship-shaming, so I’m not trying to do that now, but I’m trying to be up-front about what place I was at.

Now, I made another acct a while ago because my original acct had turned to almost all porn blogs, and I wanted something more SFW and this is the only way I could see it working. I thought to myself, why not follow some Game of Thrones blogs, as long as they look safe?

Welp, friends, as fate would have it, I accidentally followed a Jonsa blog. It didn’t bother me too much, shipping j*nerys didn’t make me love the rest of the Starks any less. The thing is, the more and more they shared, the more and more I started getting shaken up. I hadn’t seen the things they saw before. I hadn’t considered the things they were saying before. It freaked me out.

I decided I needed to do some research, really find out what all this Jonsa stuff was about. I private messaged different Jonsa specific blogs, I made this blog you see now and didn’t tell my friends. It was a whole thing.

All that being said, I really truly believe Sansa & Jon are the best for each other, but I’m really no expert. Although I wholeheartedly believe it’s the best choice, it could end up not being canonized with everything that goes along with that.

It won’t change my opinion, though, that D*ny & Jon aren’t suited for each other, that she’s not suited for ruling in general. 

And I have all you lovely Jonsas to thank for that realization. So, if I’ve ever reached out to you to talk Jonsa or Game of Thrones, just know I so appreciate you. <3
